results.title: The Way I see things
results.brief_description: Ashleigh’s older step-brother has always been there for her. Growing up without a father she turned to her step-brother, learning from his experiences and cherishing the close bond that had formed between them - a bond that Ashleigh is determined to keep.
results.description: Ashleigh’s older step-brother has always been there for her. Growing up without a father she turned to her step-brother, learning from his experiences and cherishing the close bond that had formed between them - a bond that Ashleigh is determined to keep.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Born to build
results.brief_description: Bodybuilding is more than just moving heavy metal. To Alex it is his life. Fascinated as a child with size and strength and an addiction to Marvel comics Alex finally starting pumping iron at the age of 16 and became hooked. Follow his journey in this humourous comic book style presentation as he lifts those weights and pumps that iron to build the perfect body.

group.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]

results.title: Western stories: expressions for the future. [Vol. 1]
results.brief_description:
Western Stories: Expressions for the Future is an inspirational collection of works from young people who, through their association with the Western Chances program, have been given the opportunity to tell their stories and build their own bridge to the future.
Western Chances was established to ensure that financial hardship does not prevent a young person in Melbourne’s West from achieving their maximum potential in life.

results.brief_description: Memories of the early years of Moomba, particularly of the pageant and my involvement in those early years. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: A Moomba Magic Moment
results.brief_description: It all started with my promotional photo and my girlfriend Gail Gordon, she entered me into the Moomba Quest, and the rest is history. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: Moom
results.brief_description: Mum and I would laugh at how the Moomba festival was named after our deadly mooms. Moom refers to our bottoms. A digital story created to celebrate 50 years of Melbourne Moomba Water Fest.

results.title: Memories of Moomba
results.brief_description: A selection of short films made in a Digital Storytelling workshop held to celebrate 50 years ofthe Moomba festival. The stories explore the history of the parade and life as a sun queen of moomba. It traces the history of the well known carnival family, and highlights the achievements of the key figures involved in the wild and wacky water events. Memories of Moomba was produced in collaboration with City of Melbourne and Melbourne Moomba Waterfest.
